# Changelog

## 3.1.6
* Update available sandbox models in `MODELS` (azure gpt 5 and azure o-series)
* Update available model parameters max_completion_tokens, reasoning_effort, reasoning, and verbosity

## 3.1.5
* Update available sandbox models in `MODELS` (claude opus 4, gemini 2.5, ebay qwen 3 8B)

## 3.1.4
* Update available sandbox models in `MODELS` (gpt 4.1 and gemini 2.0)

## 3.1.3
* Added 3 ebay internal sandbox models to `MODELS`

## 3.1.2
* Added chat/text ellama-3-70b sandbox models to `MODELS`
* Enable tracing headers to chomskygw

## 3.1.1
* Added new sandbox and production models to `MODELS`
* Removed deprecated models from `MODELS`

## 3.1.0
* Added tools and other missing parameters for chat completion request

## 3.0.3
* Added GPT3.5 turbo 0125 to `MODELS`

## 3.0.2
* Added GPT4 turbo 1106 to `MODELS`

## 3.0.0

* Removal 
  * `X-TARGET-PATH`
  * `X-TARGET-REQUEST-TYPE`
  * Mocha
* Added
  * Jest 
  * `MODELS` enum-like JavaScript code completion for model names
  * Custom model names
* Updated documentation

## 2.2.0
* Added `options` to dynamically customize http options like socketTimeout, tokens, etc.
* Added streaming support, source: https://wiki.corp.ebay.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=COREAI&title=Chomsky+Streaming

## 2.1.1

* Added `options.headers` support for OpenAI calls. This header is sent to Chomsky Gateway

## 2.1.0

* Added `api-version` configuration option

## 2.0.1
* Error comes with message as 'Object' when 200 response with internal error

## 2.0.0

* Added Dall-E image generation
* Added FAQs
* Created granular configurations for OpenAI calls with timeouts for each API call e.g. embedding, chat, image, completion...
* Better error handling
* Added `functions` to `chatCompletion` although it's not yet deployed to Azure


## 1.0.0

* Got ready for Invent Week

## 0.0.3

* Added staging traffic API

## 0.0.2

* Wrapper around `createChatCompletion` OpenAI API on eBay's Azure deployments

## 0.0.1

* Wrappers around `createCompletion` and `createEmbedding` OpenAI APIs on eBay's Azure deployments
